item.title: Tracking Row Level changes in PostgreSQL
item.description: Automatically Tracking Row-Level Changes in PostgreSQL Managing changes to database records is a crucial part of maintaining data integrity and transparency in a system. PostgreSQL exposes features that allow developers to automatically track changes at the row level, ensuring that every update is recorded with both a timestamp and an identifier of the application making the change. In this post, I’ll walk you through a method to implement automatic tracking of these changes using PostgreSQL triggers and functions.
